chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cherie A. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cherie A. Miller in court, in custody, with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files an Amended Information, amending Ct #1 to 943.23(3m) a Misd, and adding Ct #2 943.01(1) a Misd.  Court approves.  DEF acknowleges receipt of the Information. DEF pleads No Contest to both counts.  Found Guilty both counts.  
Ct #1: Sentence 6 months county jail IMPOSED BUT STAYED, credit for 9 days served.  DEF placed on 2 years probation,   AODA assessment  within 45 days, by July 5, 2015, and follow-through with recommendations, Restitution to be paid to Denise Johnston $2230.00.  Costs $443.00, including DNA surcharge and DEF must provide DNA tissue sample.  Any other counseling recommended by DOC.    Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.
Ct #2:  Sentence 6 months county jail, consecutive to Ct #1 IMPOSED BUT STAYED.  DEF placed on 2 years probation,   AODA assessment  within 45 days, by July 5, 2015, and follow-through with recommendations, Costs $443.00, including DNA surcharge and DEF must provide DNA tissue sample.  Any other counseling recommended by DOC.    Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.
Report to probation when released from jail.

Bond must be co-signed by Cheryl Quaderer
